result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations for Ct 2 shall be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts. Court waives court costs for Ct 1.
Defendant shall pay restitution directly to the Clerk of Courts.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not accept gifts from mother unless approved by her Power of Attorney.
Defendant shall terminate any service accounts, for his household, that are being paid from his mother's account.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles E Sullivan

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles E Sullivan in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Charles E Sullivan.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. State has filed an amended information. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to both counts in the amended information. State will recommend 1 year probation with the following conditions: pay restitution, court costs, not to receive any gifts from mother unless approved by Power of Attorney, and to terminate any services in mother's name that benefit his household. Court grant amendments. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Attorney Pozorksi heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 1 year probation for each count with the following conditions: to pay restitution, pay court costs on Ct 2 and costs on Ct 1 are waived, not to accept gift from mother unless approved by her Power of Attorney, to terminate any service accounts, for his household, that are being paid from mother's account, and to provide a DNA sample.

Defendant Charles E Sullivan in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Charles E Sullivan. William Schramm sworn and testified. Cross. Redirect. Argument heard. Court heard and finds probable cause to bind over. Information filed with same charges. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles E Sullivan in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant does qualify for SPD and is waiting for an attorney to be assigned. State requests signature bond. Court heard and orders $500 signature bond. Will schedule next court date after SPD has been assigned.
Review scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:00 am.
